get.summary:
Retrieves all enabled ONS ActivityAction Notification settings from the AFW_ONSActivityAction table.
These will contain a Y (true) value denoting that ONS notifications have been
enabled for the associated ActivityAction.
If OnsRecipientId is provided, it will be used to filter the results.

parameters.name: OnsRecipientId
parameters.description: The unique identifier to a row item on the AFW_ONSRecipient table

put.summary: Updates existing ONS ActivityAction Notification settings by matching ONS RecipientId and AFW_ActivityAction ActionId

post.summary: Receiver for messages from ONS for EMS to process and forward
post.description:
This controller is Anonymous because it is called by ONS which has not specific Agency or user context.
The context must be figured out later like the IVANS calls do.
            
When this is called for a Titan Receiver, the Authentication Code property on the NotificationMessage should be:
Authentication Code: TITAN-RDX
And the endpoint being called should match the following format (bracket segments will be replaced in Provider):
https://{base-url}/data-exchange/v1/{product-id}/{tenant-id}/entities/{entity-id}/rdx-message
            
Note: There is a special URI "https://ams360.local.vertafore.com/ems/notification/Test" for testing.
Do Not Use for real calls

parameters.name: NotificationMessagePostRequest
parameters.description: A message object that is used to create and send a notification to the receiving party

Retrieves all blocked ONS Notification Messages from the AFW_ONSMessageToProcess table.

CompanyResponse.title: CompanyResponse
CompanyResponse.description:
REST model for AFW_Company
The Company table collects information for companies doing business with 
the agency.Five different types of companies are supported:  Insurance, Finance, 
Brokerage, Fee and   Writing Companies. Only Insurance and Brokerage companies 
support writing companies.  
A company may be deleted if the company has not been used in a transaction.  
Doing so results in a soft delete setting the Status field to 'D'.  
The trigger will also soft delete associated writing companies and CompanyAddress 
records and hard delete the Underwriter, DefaultAgencyCommission, MasterAgent, 
Download Address APTInsurer, CompanyPlan and CompanyBillOptions tables. 
The company trigger also handles changes to a parent's IsHide flag and sets the 
writing companies IsHide flag to be consistent with its parent.

companyCode.description:
Parent company or Brokerage company for which the policy is written with.  
Foreign key maintained in the Company table as a unique identifier of a company. 
For Subscription Policy CoCode=^^^.  The CoType column determines what value is stored.  
If CoType = N then this is a normal company code, if type = B then this is a 
Brokerage company code. For Subscription CoType=S.
From AFW_Company.CoCode.

companyId.description:
A unique identifier that is more unique than CoCode. 
Now you can use it as a foreign key next to other entities and not get duplicate char(3) codes
From AFW_Company.CoId

name.description:
Name of Insurance, Finance,  Brokerage, Fee or Writing Company.  
No duplicate names allowed across all types except can have duplicate writing 
company names with different parent company.

naic.description:
National Association of Insurance Commissioners Company Code (NAIC Company Code). 
Used in download. The company code and NIAC code combination must be unique.

CustomerResponse.title: CustomerResponse
CustomerResponse.description:
The Customer Table (short-name = Cust) contains all the agency's customers, prospects and suspects.
In order to write a customer record, the following fields are required:  CustId, CustNo,
LastName, Status, Type, PrintCustStmt, StatePrintGroup, ARClosedDate, ARClosedStatus,
MktgFlag, IsExclDelete, IsBillNameSameAsCust, IsBillAddrSameAsCust, IsPrintAgencyBill,
IsPrintDirectBill, PremOption, and GroupingOption.
A unique CustId is generated upon insert to create the single field primary key.
At the same time that a unique CustId is generated, a unique CustNo is also generated
to create the single field alternate key.
This is intended to be a very basic model for Customer Information,
no Personal Identifiable Information (PII) should be returned with this model.
If more info is needed a new model should be created.
Note: Email is PII but it is an exception in this case

custId.description: Unique identifier for a row in the Customer table.

sortName.description: Display the customer individual name (LastName + FirstName + MiddleName) or the customer firm name (FirmNameCust).

contactName.description: Display the customer individual name (LastName + FirstName + MiddleName) or the customer firm name (FirmNameCust).

secondaryContactName.description: The name of the dependent or contact if the phone number is not directly associated with the customer.

secondaryContactType.description:
The type of contact the SecondaryContactName applies to if the phone number
is not directly associated with the customer.

secondaryEmail.description: An alternate email address for the customer

custNo.description:
Alternate key to uniquely identify a customer.
This is a displayable field may be used for the user to uniquely identify
a customer in the interface.  At the time a new CustId is generated, a new CustNo is generated.

A lightweight subset of Customer Contact info.

Only common data elements should be in this model or elements that translate such as

ActiveFormsGetRequest.title: ActiveFormsGetRequest
ActiveFormsGetRequest.description: Model containing filter criteria for getting active ACORD forms.

latestOnly.description: True to return only the latest editions of the forms, false return all active editions. The default is false.

description.description:
The description of the ACORD form to use to show to the user.
This is usually the name of the form as displayed on the form from ACORD,
for instance for the 125 it would be "Commercial Insurance Applicant Information".

number.description:
The specific ACORD Form number for instance 125 for the Commercial Applicant Information Section
Note: The latest available edition will/should always be used

state.description: The state can be null or empty in which case it is non-state specific or US

edition.description: The edition of the ACORD form in the format of MM/YYYY

mapRuleIdList.description:
The name or id of the map rule used to pull data form the database
and place it on the ACORD form. For fully converted ACORD forms
there is only one rule per form, for older UFF/XFDl hybrid forms
there is one rule per page. They will be in page order

resourceIdList.description:
The Name/ID of the ACORD Form background resource.
This must be retrieved form the map rule file since
not all entries are in the database. For fully converted ACORD forms
there is only one resource per form, for older UFF/XFDl hybrid forms
there is one resource per page. They will be in page order

hasACORDFieldNames.description:
True if the from is based on an ACORD XFDL with ACORD eLabled
fields. For instance "Producer_Name_A".

False if the form is mapped using UFF files (or hybrid UFF/XFDL). 
In this case the field names will be in the format of "FIELD_XXX" where XXX 
is a number 500 or greater.

isMappedToDatabase.description:
True if the form is fully mapped (not a partially mapped form),
otherwise false.
Partially mapped forms only maps commonly filled out fields.

elfFormVersionId.description:
This uniquely identifies the form that you want to create.
Should be used if a specific form is known.

AcordDataPostRequest.title: AcordDataPostRequest
AcordDataPostRequest.description:
Model used to request ACORD Form data for a specific ACORD Form from a policy.
The policy number can be null or empty in which case the latest active policy will be used.

customerId.description: Unique identifier, CustId, for a row in the AFW_Customer table.

policyId.description:
Unique identifier, PolId, for a row in the AFW_BasicPolInfo table.
The policy number can be null or empty in which case the latest active policy will be used.

formNumber.description:
The specific ACORD Form number for instance 125 for the Commercial Applicant Information Section
The latest available edition will always be used

formState.description:
The state can be null or empty in which case non-state specific will be used,
unless there is none or in the case as state requested does not exist,
in which case the state the policy is addressed at will be used.
If none of those work the form will return as null.

lineOfBusinessIds.description: List of line of business ids on a policy

AcordFormResponse.title: AcordFormResponse
AcordFormResponse.description:
Placeholder class for creating response model for ACORD Form Mapping (subject to change)
This is for the Form object

forms.description:
The list of XML serialized forms to be outputted.
This is set from the constructor.

The following two classes are used in both EMS and ONS. 
If you make changes, you need to update both and release at the same time.
They are called ONSMessageModel and ONSMessageModelChange in EMS

The is the version of the ONS notification:
1.0: WSAPI 2.4
2.0: WSAPI using MiddleTier 3.0
3.0: EMS - In our case it should always be 3
Sending this simply for possible validation check in EMS

A string ID used to validate the client is allowed to call EMS

customerId.description: Unique identifier, CustId, for a row in the AFW_Customer table.

companyCode.description:
Parent company or Brokerage company for which the policy is written with.  
Foreign key maintained in the Company table as a unique identifier of a company. 
For Subscription Policy CoCode=^^^.  The CoType column determines what value is stored.  
If CoType = N then this is a normal company code, if type = B then this is a 
Brokerage company code. For Subscription CoType=S.
From AFW_Company.CoCode.

companyName.description:
Name of Insurance, Finance,  Brokerage, Fee or Writing Company.  
No duplicate names allowed across all types except can have duplicate writing 
company names with different parent company.

writingCompanyCode.description:
This field is initially defaulted to the CoCode (parent company).  
The user can accept the default or specify a Writing company for the 
company or brokerage specified in CoCode. This field is required on a policy.
From AFW_Company.CoCode

policyNumber.description:
A company assigned number used to identify a policy.  If the agency does 
not have a number for a policy/application, they will assign a temporary number.

policyEffectiveDate.description:
The date the policy becomes effective.  The effective date may be changed up to one day before 
the first endorsement effective date. This is enforced through the data entry form.  
The column is required for a policy and submission.  This date will always equal the 
EffDate of the first PolT record for this policy.  Must be less than PolExpDate.

policyExpirationDate.description:
The date the policy expires.   The column cannot be null for a policy record.  If the column 
IsContinuous is checked then SQL_HIGHDATE will be stored.  Must be greater than PolEffDate.

csrCode.description:
The Account Rep for the policy.  It will be plugged from the CSR row marked 
active in the AdditionalPersonnel table.
From AFW_Employee.EmpCode, valid values are where Employee.IsRep='Y'.

executiveCode.description:
The Account Exec for the policy.  It will be plugged from the Exec row 
marked active in the AdditionalPersonnel table.
From AFW_Employee.EmpCode, valid values are where Employee.IsProd='Y'.

lineOfBusiness.description:
With the possible exception of Monoline, this field stores the translation of what's
stored in PolType (prc.Description). If PolType = M, 'Monoline' will be defaulted.
However, it will be overwritten by the PrCode.description translation of the first
non null lob.LineOfBus column attached to this policy (lob.ExpDate must = SQL_HIGHDATE
but can be any lob.EffDate).
This column is maintained entirely within SQL (spu_bpol and lob triggers).

policySubType.description:
Flag that indicates if the row is for a policy, submission or an accounting
policy (generated when processing a direct bill statement).
Valid values are:
A = Accounting
P = Policy
S = Submission

latestTransactionDate.description:
Flag that indicates if the row is for a policy, submission or an accounting
policy (generated when processing a direct bill statement).
Valid values are:
A = Accounting
P = Policy
S = Submission

glDepartmentCode.description:
Agency's department

glBranchCode.description:
Agency's Branch.

glGroupCode.description:

carrierPolicyNumber.description:
The external party Policy Number (this could be something like "POL1234" or a Guid)
AMS360 will attempt to use this along with the CarrierPolicyEffectiveDate and NAIC in order to find the matching AMS360 PolicyId
in order to perform an add of Policy Contact if no matching contact is found to update (and EntityId is not provided)

carrierPolicyEffectiveDate.description:
The external party Policy Effective Date
AMS360 will attempt to use this along with the CarrierPolicyNumber and NAIC in order to find the matching AMS360 PolicyId
in order to perform an add of Policy Contact if no matching contact is found to update (and EntityId is not provided)

naic.description:
The external NAIC code
AMS360 will attempt to use this along with CarrierPolicyNumber and CarrierPolicyEffectiveDate in order to find the matching AMS360 PolicyId
in order to perform an add of Policy Contact if no matching contact is found to update (and EntityId is not provided)

entityId.description: The external id of the entity the contact is attached to (AMS360 assumes this to be the PolicyId if provided)

policyId.description: The AMS360 policy id that the contact is attached to

accountId.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The External AccountId

address.title: AddressModel
address.description: The model containing the contact address

createdOn.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The external date of the contact creation

description.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The external description of the contact

emailAddresses.description: The list of email address models for the contact (AMS360 will only use one)

familyName.description: The last name of the contact (AMS360 will combine this with GivenName)

givenName.description: The first name of the contact (AMS360 will combine this with FamilyName)

id.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The unique Id of the contact

isPrimary.description:
(This property is not used by AMS360) 
Identifies the Primary responsible.
Valid values are:
    Y = Yes
    N = No

phoneNumbers.description:
The list of phone numbers for the contact.
AMS360 has specific Phone Number types that it must match on in order to be stored,
otherwise it will try using one marked as Primary:
    Business - Business Phone
    Residence - Residence Phone
    Mobile - Cell Phone
    Pager - Pager Phone Number
    Fax - Fax Phone Number

primary.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) If the contact is a primary contact

tenantId.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The Id of the external tenant

type.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The contact type

updatedOn.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The external date of a contact update

preferredContactMethod.description:
The Preferred Method of Contact for this Policy Contact
Values supported by AMS360:
    Business Phone
    Cell
    Text Message
    Residence Phone
    Fax
    Pager
    Other
    Customer Address
    Email #1 
    Email #2
    Intl Phone #1
    Intl Phone #2

description.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The external description of the contact address

accountId.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The external AccountId of the contact address

country.description: The Country Code of the address (i.e. US)

formattedAddress.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The formatted full address

mailing.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) Denotes if this is a mailing address

preferred.description: Denotes if this address is preferred

Denotes if this email is preferred over others.
AMS360 will take this email if true (or first email in the list if all true or all false for all emails)

type.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The type of the email

canReceiveFax.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) Denotes if this number can receive a fax

canReceiveText.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) Denotes if this number can receive text messages

countryCode.description: The country code for the phone number (i.e. 1 for US)

extension.description: The extension (if any) for the phone number

phoneNumber.description: The phone number itself, including area code (may be formatted)

preferred.description: Denotes if this phone number is preferred over others

type.description:
AMS360 keys off of this value in order to store the phone into the DB
Valid values are:
    Business
    Residence
    Mobile
    Pager
    Fax

The URI to the next page.
This attribute may be null. It is only filled for endpoints that support the NextPageLink

The total count of page results of possible items.
